answers.answer: I'm a ++ pregnancy with diabetes running in the family but only just had mine yesterday at 28+5

This is so confusing to me. I do not know of anyone else who had to take the test so early. I know I was still ++ with my first pregnancy and didnt test until way later on and it was negative. So confused. The problem is that my first visit with my actual OB will not be until right after I take this test. I dont know that she would have even wanted me to have done this. Just frustrated and confused. Do not need the stress of this test right now.
I'd ask your mid wife why as the type of diabetes doesn't strike till later on in pregnancy. I wouldn't worry over it tho.

the test isn't so bad.  They just want to make sure everything is ok for you and baby.    I just did mine at 28wks but I know my GF said she felt off one day so she did one at the lab that she works at early.  She'll have to do another one at 28wks but she just wanted to make sure.

Hey even if you fail this test doesn't mean there's something wrong....I've only gain 10lbsI just did my glucose testSaturday at 26weeks preg.I fail and Im gonna go do my 3 hr test next SaturdaySo don't stress  your selfTry to relaxTake care. X

question: Hello,Today I am going to the doctor for my 13 week checkup and the mid wife I seen during my first official appointment requested that I take the test early for gestational diabetes. I am on the heavier side so I guess I understand but with my first pregnancy I did not have it and am concerned if there is anything else I should be worried about. I am nervous beyond belief as I really do not want to have any complications and feel that taking this test early is a sign that they saw something. Has anyone else had to take the test early? Any feelings on why besides weight, that I would have to take it so early?
title: Gestational Diabetes Test at 13 weeks
